quest.name: On Thin Ice
journal: Gaia's recent ordeals have left her rather more subdued than usual.

The emergence of the dark force within Gaia has provided few answers to the questions that remain concerning its origin and true purpose. With the mysterious entity nowhere to be seen and its host having regained her senses, the rest of the group resume the plan to revitalize the element of ice, this time using Shiva as a basis for the summoning. Upon hearing of the manner in which Ysayle made herself a vessel for the primal's power, Ryne states her desire to use a similar approach. As ice naturally tends towards stasis and stillness, it is the element most closely aligned with Light, and would require far more effort to draw forth and rebalance. She claims this difficulty could be greatly alleviated by directly influencing the flow of aether by using her own body as a conduit, rather than relying solely on Eden. Your role, as ever, is to defeat the primal, although considerable care must be taken to disperse the aether without harming Ryne. As one might expect, Thancred vehemently opposes the plan at first, though he is forced to concede when met with the steely determination in her eyes. You and Ryne focus your thoughts on Shiva, and commence the summoning. With an even greater sense of trepidation than usual, you prepare for a climactic battle with the goddess of ice.

※Eden's Verse: Refulgence can be accessed via the Duty Finder.

Despite Ryne's not-so-carefully laid plans going awry almost immediately, the battle reaches a largely satisfactory conclusion, thanks in no small part to the unexpected intervention of Gaia. Her much improved control of her dark powers is instrumental in freeing Ryne from Shiva's possession, and after the ice-aspected aether dissipates, Gaia rushes to aid the Oracle of Light. As Ryne returns to her senses, she and her unlikely savior engage in some light-hearted banter and make various plans for when they return to civilization, including making necklaces from a shard of ice left by Shiva.

Having overcome various obstacles and hardships, you and your companions return to Eden's core. Ryne, in particular, is somewhat worse for wear, although she is also the most eager to see what change has come as a result of the extraordinary events that have unfolded.

With balance restored to the last of the six elements, you return to the camp. For the first time since the Flood of Light, verdant green has returned to the Empty, with tufts of foliage peeking through the now fertile soil. It remains to be seen, however, if the work of rebalancing the ambient aether is truly complete, or if further challenges lie ahead.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: We still don't know exactly what happened, but at least the danger's passed for now.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Whatever that thing was, it was able to control a vast swarm of sin eaters, much like Vauthry. Then again, it's clearly nothing like a Lightwarden... In any case, it's gone now. I just hope it stays gone.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Though Gaia hath regained consciousness, I surmise that it shall be some time before she is fully recovered from her ordeal.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: You've all gone through a lot of trouble on my part. For what it's worth, I'm sorry. Anyway, I've delayed you for long enough. Please, carry on with what you came to do.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I'm glad you're back to your usual self, but how are you feeling?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Much better now, but something is still bothering me. The faerie spoke to me in a dream, and a stream of memories rushed through my mind. I don't recall anything like this happening before, and I'm not sure what it all means.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: What sort of memories?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: I can't make any sense of them. They were only brief flashes, seen through someone else's eyes. At least, that's what it felt like.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Minfilia─that is, the first Oracle of Light─once served Hydaelyn as the Word of the Mother.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: If the Oracle of Darkness is her counterpart under Zodiark, then we had best prepare ourselves for the worst.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Aye, the night's return did tip the aetherial balance towards activity, which may have served to awaken the fragment of His power in the First.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Having thus roused, He did then fix His gaze upon she who had been marked by Darkness─Gaia.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Marked or no, Gaia's still her own person.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Hmm? Everything all right?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: I-It's nothing.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Anyway, let's forget about all that for now. There'll be plenty of time to think it through once the last element's restored.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: If thou believest thyself well enough, then I see no reason for delay. Let us forthwith attend to the revitalization of ice.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Shiva, then. Forename, as the only one here to have actually seen the primal, perhaps you could describe her for us?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: A woman named Ysayle made herself a vessel for Shiva.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: She and the great wyrm Hraesvelgr shared an undying bond.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: So, she summoned into her body the imagined essence of someone who lived over a thousand years ago? That such a thing should be possible...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: To find a kindred spirit in such an ancient and fearsome creature... I can hardly imagine what sort of a person she must've been.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The long since departed Shiva was a source of great inspiration to Ysayle, whose method of summoning differed greatly from any we had previously encountered.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: By the Echo did she bear witness to the deeds of the noble Shiva, and thus was she moved to dedicate her being to that selfsame cause. 'Twas this devotion that granted her the power of a primal.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: So, she was able to control it herself...?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Not getting any funny ideas, are you?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Ah, just thinking aloud, that's all! Anyway, we'd better get going.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Our journey leadeth to a great glacier situated in the northernmost region of the Empty.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I'll get us there as quickly as I can!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: It's time to draw out the aether.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Umm... I was thinking...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: ...That I should go with you this time. I want to be the vessel for Shiva!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Being still and passive by nature, ice is the element that is the most strongly aligned to Light. I'll need to get close and use my own abilities as well as Eden's to draw it out.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: So that the Oracle of Light becometh the Oracle of Ice...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I cannot claim to be in favor of this stratagem, and yet... The primal we encountered in the Source was summoned in much the same manner. The inherent advantages are undeniable─

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Absolutely out of the question!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Have you forgotten what Forename does to the primals we summon!? I'm not about to stand by and watch as shehe and Ryne beat the tar out of each other.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: In any case, the aether only returns to the Empty once the creature's been slain, although it seems you haven't taken that into consideration yet. Presumably, there's a safe way to disperse it, but it's still far too risky.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: ...I thought you had more sense, Ryne.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: But it's not as bad as it sounds!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Were the deiform entity as volatile as the primals we have previously summoned, 'twould be logical to assume that, in her role as conduit, Ryne would be hard-pressed to retain control.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Forename would have no recourse but to defend herselfhimself by any means necessary, else herhis life be forfeit.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I know it's dangerous, but I can't let that hold me back. Please, I've got to try!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: But I don't see why this is even necessary in the first place. You never had to take risks like this for the other elements.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Eden possesses almost infinite power, but what would happen if it began acting without my intervention?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: If it started to feed on the aether, just like other sin eaters, it would undo all of our hard work!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Tis a disconcerting eventuality, and one which cannot be dismissed.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I'm worried that even if we realign the elements, things will eventually return to how they were following the Flood.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: But if I train Eden how to nurture the environment rather than drain the life from it, we can leave it to take care of the Empty in our place. I'll channel the aether through myself, and show Eden how it's done!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: This isn't some house pet we're dealing with! If it all goes wrong, then what?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I know this all sounds like I'm taking a leap of faith, but it has been a gamble every step of the way.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: We've managed to come this far because of faith─in ourselves and in each other.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: <sigh> I've made my feelings on the matter perfectly clear, but what say you, Forename?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: With my memories to guide the summoning, what could possibly go wrong?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I'll hold back as much as possible.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Ryne, I suppose that if you've got your heart set on this, there's no point trying to dissuade you. Just don't do anything reckless, is that clear?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: As crystal!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: This is going to work, I promise. I'll make sure of it.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Well, for all our sakes, I certainly hope so. Because if the primal takes over...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: It'll be fine. With all of you by my side, I know that whatever happens, it'll work out in the end.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: All of us? I hope you're not including me. I can't even deal with my own problems, never mind yours.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: It's enough just knowing you're here. Anyway, I've decided to take a leaf out of your book. “I do what I want, when I want.” I've made my decision, so now I have to see it through.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Yes, but this is a different kettle of fish altogether!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Well, the point is that this is what I want, and I'll do whatever it takes to make it work!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: So, this is how much it means to you...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Memories of Shiva envelop your mind...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I don't know how...but I can see her too! This might actually work!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I think Eden is sending your thoughts to me! I see Ysayle... And Shiva... They only wanted peace, a land where dragon and mankind could live side by side.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: With so many things left to chance, all I can do is wait...and pray. Do you think the Twelve can hear me here in the First?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Both Ysayle and Archbishop Thordan offered their corporeal forms as vessels, unto which the likenesses of preeminent figures from Ishgardian history were projected. However, the nature in which each met their demise is perhaps best not dwelled upon...

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: So, she's not just waiting for the future to arrive, but actually trying to change it?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Ryne!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: You were there... I heard you...

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: What happened to Shiva? Is she still in control?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: No, she's gone... But, Gaia...

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: That hammer... It matches your dress...

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Hmph. I see you're back to your normal idiotic self.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Look... Isn't it pretty? Maybe we could take it with us?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Erm... Ice tends to melt, you know.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Not this sort.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Well, if you say so.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Anyway, it might even make a nice necklace.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: That's a brilliant idea!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Wilt thou not rush to her aid?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Perhaps I'm getting slow in my old age, because it would seem Gaia's beaten me to it.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: To think that she would be the one to break the ice. Ahem.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: They may have gotten off to a rocky start, but I think they'll make quite the pair.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Is that a hint of melancholy I detect in thy voice? Something akin to a pining mother bird whose chicks have flown the nest...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Father bird, if you don't mind. But aye, you're not entirely wrong.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Still, when the day finally comes to say good-bye, it heartens me to know she won't be alone.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: After that, we can go to the Second Serving for coffee biscuits!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Fine. You win. And if they're anything less than perfection itself, I'll never let you live it down!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: If they're not to your liking...there are plenty of other things to try!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: I suppose we both deserve a little treat after all that hard work. Hehe!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: We certainly do! Hehehe!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: There we were, laughing as if we had not a care in the world. Fleeting though it was, in that moment, I was content.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: But my life was never meant to be so simple.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I've had my share of close shaves, but that was...terrifying, to put it mildly. I can only hope the end justifies the means.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Ice, being most naturally aligned to Light among all elements, did interact with Ryne's innate gifts in ways unforeseen.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Were we not graced with the timely appearance of the Oracle of Darkness, I fear that this tale would have ended somewhat prematurely...

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: I let myself get a little carried away there, but I was definitely the one controlling my powers, not the other way around. Even so, I hope I never have to use them again.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I'm so sorry, everyone. I clearly have a long way to go before I can handle that kind of power.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: But we achieved what we set out to do, as I had faith we would. So without further ado, let's return to camp and admire our work.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: It's...life!
